envShiny 0.1.0
  • Reference

Plot area of interest

Source: R/plot_aoi.R
plot_aoi.Rd

Create a simple ggplot of an AOI and, optionally, the 'base' vector used to create the aoi without buffers/filtering, and a region_taxa polygon. Map extent is set to the wider of SA or the AOI, or can be set manually to just the AOI with `zoom`.

plot_aoi(extent_sf, extent_poly = NULL, region_taxa_sf = NULL, zoom = FALSE)

Arguments

extent_sf

An `sf` object of the actual extent i.e. the AOI, e.g. from `tar_read(extent_sf)`.

extent_poly

An `sf` object of the base vector used to build `extent_sf`, e.g. from H:/data/vector.

region_taxa_sf

An `sf` object to add to the map, e.g. from tar_read(region_taxa_sf)

zoom

Logical. Set the map extent to `extent_sf`? Works well with a `bslib::input_switch` input.

Value

ggplot2 object with `extent_sf` overlayed on an SA/Aus map, with optional `extent_poly` and `region_taxa`.

Details

Requires `sa` and `aus` sf objects to build the map - usually as found in data/vector. They are NOT included in this package. Map crs is set to `crs(aus)`.

Contents
